of all things hat woolly wormhead round 1 k2 p2 to end that link also shows how to take the length measurement repeat round 1 until the fabric measures 1 5 1 75 2 2 2″ / 4 you ll need measure from the base of one earlobe to the top 4 5 5 5 5 cm from co edge of the head where a hat crown usually sits this is not a vertical measurement it s angled toward the back or your switch to larger needles and mc yarn head a bit this number gives you a good idea of how long to make the hat body before you begin the decreases round 2 k all break cc yarn leaving a 5 6″ 12 15 cm tail to weave in having said all that this clearly isn t a hat with a fitted crown and you can make it as long as you like exact hat height the hat body all sizes isn t really important here just remember that a longer hat requires more yarn with the mc and larger needles repeat rnds 1-2 of the 2x2 broken rib stitch until the hat reaches the top of your head ending after round 2 this pattern may not be reproduced or decrease 8 sts each time working in pattern again for approx 1″ / 2 5 cm after each decrease round ending after round 1 in the next round you ll be adding three additional stitch markers to separate the stitches into four equal sections of repeat this sequence 6 8 10 12 times in total when you ll 16 20 24 28 sts the markers make it easier to do the have 16 sts remaining on your needles 4 sts in each section decreases without counting stitches though you can leave between stitch markers at this point you can remove all them out if you don t need them non-bor sms if you want setup round final decreases remove bor marker k2tog to end decreases 8 sts 8 sts remaining k1 replace bor marker k three rnds *k1 p2 k1 repeat from * 3 4 5 6 more times pm k2tog to end decreases 4 sts 4 sts remaining repeat 3 more times to new bor placement break yarn and pull it through the 4 remaining sts 2x2 broken rib decrease rounds *k1 k2tog k to 3 sts before marker ssk k1 sm see notes section at the end for
